DataElement.preferredName: Patient Exceptional Response Clinical Trial Informed Consent Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to specify a grouping for patients on an exceptional responder clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Exceptional Response Clinical Trial Informed Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An achievement of either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:An achievement of either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
An achievement of either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent.

Property.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.:Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

Concepts.definition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
